intro: Dracophyllum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dracophyllum, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heaths. The plant is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Dracophyllum angustifolium is adapted to dry conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant.
